page.title: 16LUDFORD_POPULATION & HOUSING
page.content: POPULATION in Ludford in 1983 was 311. 80% of village in this Grid area and estimated at 249 = 187 adults & 62 children. There are 53 retired people. HOUSING _ 110 dwellings of which 84 are mostly owner occuped _ little rented accommodation _ and 25 public housing (Council Houses) of which 11 are specially for the elderly. 3 week_ end cottages owned by people living away. Whilst the 2 Pubs date from 1730 there is only one House which is a Listed Building _ the Red House, which has been empty for some years. 50 Houses are pre 1918 war,mostly Victor_ ian: 6 were built between the wars and 29 plus the Council Houses built Post WWII. Estimated 68 dwellings have cars & 66 on telephone.Many have central heating _ by Electricity, Oil, Solid Fuel and latterly Gas supplied to tanks but many also retain coal fires.
